metadata.title: CVE-2020-2584 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Options). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.28 and priorand 8.0.18 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows highprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to allMySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.4 (Confidentialityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mariadb-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
